revised_title: Magnetic Phenomena and Electricity: Davy's Experiments
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy investigates the magnetic phenomena produced by electricity, expanding on Oersted's experiments. He discovers that the magnetic power is proportional to the quantity of electricity passing through a given space, and that the finer the wires, the stronger their magnetism. He also demonstrates that the magnetic effect can be produced at a distance through air, water, and even through thick plates of glass.
